verses.verse: Bel <WH1078> boweth down, <WH3766> Nebo <WH5015> stoopeth, <WH7164> their idols <WH6091> were <WH1961> upon the beasts, <WH2416> and upon the cattle: <WH929> your carriages <WH5385> were heavy laden; <WH6006> they are a burden <WH4853> to the weary <WH5889> beast.

They stoop, <WH7164> they bow down <WH3766> together; <WH3162> they could <WH3201> not <WH3808> deliver <WH4422> the burden, <WH4853> but themselves <WH5315> are gone <WH1980> into captivity. <WH7628>

Hearken <WH8085> unto <WH413> me, O house <WH1004> of Jacob, <WH3290> and all <WH3605> the remnant <WH7611> of the house <WH1004> of Israel, <WH3478> which are borne <WH6006> by me from <WH4480> the belly, <WH990> which are carried <WH5375> from <WH4480> the womb: <WH7356>

And even to <WH5704> your old age <WH2209> I <WH589> am he; <WH1931> and even to <WH5704> hoar hairs <WH7872> will I <WH589> carry <WH5445> you: I <WH589> have made, <WH6213> and I <WH589> will bear; <WH5375> even I <WH589> will carry, <WH5445> and will deliver <WH4422> you.
To whom <WH4310> will ye liken <WH1819> me, and make me equal, <WH7737> and compare <WH4911> me, that we may be like? <WH1819>

They lavish <WH2107> gold <WH2091> out of the bag, <WH4480> <WH3599> and weigh <WH8254> silver <WH3701> in the balance, <WH7070> and hire <WH7936> a goldsmith; <WH6884> and he maketh <WH6213> it a god: <WH410> they fall down, <WH5456> yea, <WH637> they worship. <WH7812>

They bear <WH5375> him upon <WH5921> the shoulder, <WH3802> they carry <WH5445> him, and set <WH5117> him in his place, <WH8478> and he standeth; <WH5975> from his place <WH4480> <WH4725> shall he not <WH3808> remove: <WH4185> yea, <WH637> one shall cry <WH6817> unto <WH413> him, yet can he not <WH3808> answer, <WH6030> nor <WH3808> save <WH3467> him out of his trouble. <WH4480> <WH6869>
Remember <WH2142> this, <WH2063> and show yourselves men: <WH377> bring it again <WH7725> to <WH5921> mind, <WH3820> O ye transgressors. <WH6586>

Remember <WH2142> the former things <WH7223> of old: <WH4480> <WH5769> for <WH3588> I <WH595> am God, <WH410> and there is none <WH369> else; <WH5750> I am God, <WH430> and there is none <WH657> like me, <WH3644>

Declaring <WH5046> the end <WH319> from the beginning, <WH4480> <WH7225> and from ancient times <WH4480> <WH6924> the things that <WH834> are not <WH3808> yet done, <WH6213> saying, <WH559> My counsel <WH6098> shall stand, <WH6965> and I will do <WH6213> all <WH3605> my pleasure: <WH2656>

Calling <WH7121> a ravenous bird <WH5861> from the east, <WH4480> <WH4217> the man <WH376> that executeth my counsel <WH6098> from a far <WH4801> country: <WH4480> <WH776> yea, <WH637> I have spoken <WH1696> it, I will also <WH637> bring it to pass; <WH935> I have purposed <WH3335> it, I will also <WH637> do <WH6213> it.
Hearken <WH8085> unto <WH413> me, ye stouthearted, <WH47> <WH3820> that are far <WH7350> from righteousness: <WH4480> <WH6666>

I bring near <WH7126> my righteousness; <WH6666> it shall not <WH3808> be far off, <WH7368> and my salvation <WH8668> shall not <WH3808> tarry: <WH309> and I will place <WH5414> salvation <WH8668> in Zion <WH6726> for Israel <WH3478> my glory. <WH8597>
